text: Schematic diagrams of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> structure and its role in signaling .
<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contains two N-terminal WW domains , a C-terminal short-chain alcohol dehydrogenase / reductase ( SDR ) domain , and a D3 region .
A nuclear localization signal ( NLS ) is in between the WW domains ( Chang et al . , 2003 , 2007 ; Del Mare et al . , 2011 ; Salah et al . , 2012 ; Su et al . , 2012 ; reviews ) .
The SDR domain possesses a mitochondria - binding region .
There are two conserved tyrosine phosphorylation sites , Tyr33 and Tyr287 .
Other phosphorylation sites predicted by NetPhos 2.0 Server are Tyr6 , Thr12 , Ser14 , Tyr61 , Tyr293 , and Thr3B3 , respectively .
Upon stress stimulation , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is phosphorylated in Tyr33 and binds <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The WWOX / p53 complex then translocates to mitochondria or nucleus to induce apoptosis .

<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also binds PPxY motif-containing transcription factors , such as <extra_id_0> RUNX2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> ERBB4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , via its first WW domain , and the binding blocks the activity of these proteins by retaining them in the cytoplasm .
<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds <extra_id_0> Tau <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> via its SDR domain .
<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> participates in the Wnt / beta-catenin signal pathway by binding Dvl and inhibiting its nuclear import .

Phorbol ester stimulates the dissociation of MEK / WWOX complex in Jurkat T cell , and the released <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> translocates to the mitochondria for causing cell death .

<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is recruited to the membrane area by association with <extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and phospho - <extra_id_0> Ezrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
<extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is an alternative receptor for <extra_id_0> TGF-beta1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In response to <extra_id_0> TGF-beta1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds <extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and forms a complex , followed by relocating to the nucleus and enhancing the SMAD - driven promoter activity .

<extra_id_0> Ack1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> activated Cdc42-associated kinase 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; <extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> hyaluronoglucosaminidase 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; CKI , casein kinase ; GSK , glycogen synthase kinase ; PKA , protein kinase A .
